title: BBC Local Live: Derbyshire on Monday 30 January 2017 - BBC News
summary: arts centre remembers patron sir john hurt .
calls for florence nightingale statue to be moved .
brewers boss nigel clough not going to forest .
will hughes likely to miss ipswich v derby .
news , sport , travel and weather updates resume at 08:00 tuesday .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: today 's local live updates have now finished .
we 'll be back with more news , sport , travel and weather at 08:00 on tuesday .

documents.title: weather : mild and mainly dry tonight
text: staying largely dry and cloudy this evening with the odd break in cloud likely .
cloudy overnight with patchy light rain and drizzle moving across from the west .
lows of 4c ( 39f ) .
author: Lucy Martin
BBC Weather

documents.title: latest headlines for derbyshire and east staffordshire
text: here are the top stories we 've been covering today :
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: youngest anti-trump protester ?
text: could five-year-old emily be the youngest protester in derby ?
she 's waving this placard against president trump 's immigration policy in the us .
author: Wesley Mallin
Reporter, BBC Radio Derby

documents.title: watch : civic society on nightingale statue
text: here 's derby civic society 's richard felix talking about where he 'd like to see the florence nightingale statue on london road move to .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: clough staying with brewers
text: nigel clough has ended discussions with nottingham forest and will stay on at burton albion .
in a statement , the club said clough was `` fully focused on continuing the job he is so successfully doing '' .
author: Owen Bradley
BBC Radio Derby Sport

documents.title: watch : the hunt for illegal tobacco
text: a short preview of my inside out report on the hunt for illicit tobacco in the east midlands .
you can see the full-length version on bbc one at 19:30 .
author: Nisha Chopra
BBC Radio Leicester Newsreader

documents.title: clough forest switch off ?
text: sky sports reporter tweets
sky sources : talks between # nffc and clough have collapsed .
clough not happy with package and stability , fawaz not happy with clough demands
not at all .
pearce did n't have a proper job .
clough does
a lucrative management offer & fall back into punditry if fail easy decision
nigel 's demand was that this be removed from the # nffc boardroom .
he no doubt found it offensive
let 's face it it 's a complete joke a real piss take ! !
@ twitterid hoping this is zach and not nigel
i know haha , but think it 's nigel .
realised after i retreated
should imagine all nigel asked for was structure and no interference !
shows you that fawaz has no intention of changing # nffc
well done nigel , right decision .
yeah demands like , i want to the side # nffc # fawazout
how dare nigel ask for the basic structure that is at every football club
@ twitterid thank fuck for that !
clough 's demands ? what like a proper structure in place , being allowed to his own team & who tosign/sell like other managers
@ twitterid
gutted nigel is not coming tho ca n't blame him / al hasawi is an egotistical deluded compulsive liar & who can work for that
yes , demanding basic levels of competence and decency must have been a harrowing prospect for fah .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: oil spill in bakewell
text: the environment agency says it is dealing with an oil spill in the river wye in bakewell .
paul reeves , from the agency , said the fire service was also involved in efforts to stop the oil from spreading .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: police point out problem parking
text: school parking patrols @ twitterid and homefields primary school this afternoon .
the below thought this was a good place to park

documents.title: your views : should we move nightingale statue ?
text: calls to move derby 's florence nightingale statue from its current position in london road have n't been universally welcomed .
on our facebook page , sam pearch posted : `` leave it where it is , she was part of the london road hospital not the current one .
`` have her cleaned and the area tidied up and then fenced off to protect her , once the land is built on she will be a memory for the dri standing proud for all to view . ''
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: council phone lines down
text: derby city council says it 's having problems with its phones this afternoon .
the issue is affecting the authority 's council tax , business rates and streetpride lines .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: trump petition continues to grow
text: more than 2,000 people in burton and south derbyshire have so far signed the petition calling for a block on us president donald trump being given a state visit to the uk .
author: Burton Mail

documents.title: dead man 's body missed by betting shop staff
text: gambling firm betfred says it has apologised to the family of a man who died in the toilets at its chesterfield branch but was n't discovered until the following morning .
the derbyshire times reports john cole , 65 , from loundsley green , died of natural causes at the burlington road betting shop in november and was found by a cleaner the next day .
the firm confirmed the incident to the bbc and said it had met with the family , who have also been sent a letter of apology by managing director mark stebbings .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: sad state of nightingale statue
text: florence nightingale , famously known as the lady with the lamp , grew up in derbyshire before her work during the crimean war changed the face of nursing .
derby civic society 's richard felix said that as well as needing to be moved , her statue was in desperate need of a clean .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: could 'lady with the lamp ' light up victoria street ?
text: richard felix , from derby civic society , said the florence nightingale statue needed moving from london road as soon as possible .
he said : `` this is one of the most famous women in the world but here she is , rather forlorn .
nobody sees her .
`` i 'd like to see her - and queen victoria , who 's about 100 yards down the road - brought to victoria street .
`` the two most famous victorian women in the world - one at one end and one at the other . ''
author: James Roberson
Reporter, East Midlands Today

documents.title: thorne eyeing rams return
text: steve mcclaren says george thorne has undergone a successful operation to have a pin removed from his leg .
the recovery time is about eight weeks before he can return to training - target for a first team return is pre-season .
author: Owen Bradley
BBC Radio Derby Sport

documents.title: hughes 'struggling ' to make ipswich game
text: at the derby county news conference , steve mcclaren says will hughes is unlikely to feature against ipswich town tomorrow night after up a knock against leicester city on friday .
author: Owen Bradley
BBC Radio Derby Sport

documents.title: where should nightingale statue go ?
text: she 's one of the most famous people in the world - yet supporters say her statue in derby is sadly overlooked .
florence nightingale 's effigy stands alongside the site of the old derbyshire royal infirmary in the city , which has now been demolished .
an online petition suggests she should be moved to the royal derby hospital but richard felix from derby civic society says he would like to see it moved to victoria street in the city centre .
author: James Roberson
Reporter, East Midlands Today

documents.title: man suffers head injury in burton assault
text: a man needed stitches for a head injury after being attacked while walking home from a night out in burton .
police said the 31-year-old was taken to hospital after being assaulted on gordon street shortly before 05:00 yesterday .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: no news on clough forest switch
text: we 've heard nothing so far today on whether burton albion boss nigel clough will be leaving to join nottingham forest .
we 'll let you know as soon as we hear anything .
author: BBC Derby Sport

documents.title: generous mp paid for derby museum
text: i ca n't believe the museum 's been around for 138 years - it does n't look a day over 100 !
did you know that following a gift of money from michael thomas bass , an mp to build a new museum , the current museum opened in 1879 ?
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: this afternoon 's weather : dull for some
text: it will be dry with some brighter spells developing through this afternoon but some places will remain dull throughout .
highs of 7c ( 45f ) .
author: Sara Blizzard
BBC Weather

documents.title: follow the rams in the fa cup draw
text: if you 're planning to watch this evening 's fa cup fifth-round draw , derby county are ball number two ( along with leicester city ) .
england boss gareth southgate will be doing the honours - it 's on bbc two at 19:00 .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: remembering sir john hurt
text: in case you were wondering , my favourite sir john hurt films are the elephant man ( which i 've seen at least eight times ) and 1984 .
what are your favourites ?
send me an email .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: sneaky tactics of illegal tobacco traders
text: we were given permission to go out with trading standards officers and see their work dealing with illegal tobacco sellers .
the first shop we went to , their sniffer dog went straight to a fridge hidden in a back room and within minutes his handler found stacks of illegal fags hidden in the top compartment .
in another shop , a van was used as a decoy to hide a locker which contained bags of illegal tobacco .
it 's amazing just how crafty they were in hiding their product .
in some shops we saw the remains of electro magnets where cigarettes have been stored under the floor and behind walls , which are accessed by remote control .
you can watch my full report on bbc inside out east midlands at 19:30 on bbc one or on iplayer after .
author: Nisha Chopra
BBC Inside Out reporter

documents.title: water problems in littleover
text: if you live in littleover and your water 's gone off or you 've noticed a drop in pressure this morning , severn trent says there 's a burst pipe at the junction of abbey street and monk street .
the firm says it has a team on site and hopes to have things back to normal asap .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: illegal tobacco 'for sale at dozens of shops '
text: in derby , trading standards officers seized more than 700,000 illegal cigarettes between march 2015 and december 2016 .
they say it 's a trade which is run by organised criminal gangs and at least 60 corner shops in derby are known to be selling illegal tobacco under the counter .
author: BBC Inside Out

documents.title: east midlands is illegal tobacco hotspot
text: it 's been revealed the east midlands is one of the worst areas in the country for the sale of illicit tobacco .
in the past two years , four million fake cigarettes have been seized .
that 's a loss of about £ 1.5m in tax revenue .
author: BBC Inside Out

documents.title: man found dead in betting shop
text: betfred has donated £ 5,000 to charity in memory of a former serviceman who lay dead overnight in the toilets of its chesterfield store .
author: Derbyshire Times

documents.title: classroom slippers trend comes to county
text: a school in derbyshire is following a worldwide trend by allowing pupils wear slippers in the classroom after studies have shown that it can improve learning .
author: Derby Telegraph

documents.title: watch : rams 2-2 foxes
text: if you 've not seen the goals from derby county 's 2-2 fa cup draw with leicester city on friday , you can watch the full highlights below , courtesy of bbc sport .
that result means the rams will be in the hat for tonight 's fifth round draw - due to take place live on bbc two at 19:00 .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: quad to stage sir john hurt tribute event
text: derby 's quad arts centre has also posted a tribute to its patron sir john hurt on its website .
chief executive adam buss described the actor as `` one of the most caring , inspiring and brilliant people who have visited us '' and said the venue would be hosting an event to celebrate his life .

documents.title: your photos : winter in derbyshire
text: great conditions for walking in derbyshire this weekend .
weather watcher sojourner snapped these hikers tackling the longshaw estate on sunday morning .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: armed officers in kirk hallam manhunt
text: a man was arrested in kirk hallam last night after allegedly threatening to kill a woman .
armed police were deployed to search for the man at about 18:00 amid fears he could be carrying a weapon following a `` domestic incident '' .
he was found unarmed on queen elizabeth way at about 21:30 but was detained on sus of making threats to kill .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: clough pondering forest move
text: we 're still waiting to hear whether nigel clough is going to leave burton albion to take charge of nottingham forest .
he was asked about the potential switch after saturday 's 2-1 win at qpr and said : `` it 's going to be a difficult couple of days .
i ca n't tell you any more than that at the moment . ''
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: latest headlines for derbyshire and east staffordshire
text: here 's a reminder of our top stories this morning :
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: travel : motorway crash
text: a crash on the m42 southbound has led to congestion stretching as far back as burton .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: watch : sir john hurt on derby quad patron role
text: here 's the star of 1984 and the elephant man talking to bbc east midlands today in 2014 about why he agreed to become a patron of derby 's quad arts centre .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: remembering sir john hurt
text: derby 's quad arts centre has been paying tribute to its patron sir john hurt following the actor 's death .

chief executive adam buss told bbc radio derby : `` he was one of those unique characters you meet who 's not only incredibly interesting but also incredibly interested in other people - it was n't a one-way track .
`` he was always interested in what was going on at quad and the film industry - especially where young people could benefit from accessing things they would n't normally see or experience . ''

`` the silly thing i 'll always remember is him on our fifth birthday coming to quad and being in the cafe bar among everyone else , cutting into the cake , speaking to people , signing autographs and just being a genuinely brilliant human being . ''
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : monday 's weather
text: here 's today 's forecast
author: Sara Blizzard
BBC Weather

documents.title: travel : no major incidents
text: nothing out of the ordinary on the roads of derbyshire at the moment , unlike yesterday 's m1 canoe drama .
there is however congestion in the usual spots .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: good morning : join us for today 's live updates
text: hi everyone .
i hope whatever you did this weekend it was wonderful .
i 'll be bringing you all of monday 's news , sport , travel and weather over the next few hours .
send me your comments and questions via email , facebook or twitter .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live
